item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Life's as kind as you let it be." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "dogs and angels are not very far apart" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I don't hate people. I just feel better when they aren't around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "If you are going to try, go all the way or don't even start. If you follow it you will be alive with the gods. It is the only good fight there is." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
item.description: "It is very important that you only do what you love to do. you may be poor, you may go hungry, you may lose your car, you may have to move into a shabby place to live, but you will totally live. And at the end of your days you will bless your life because you have done what you came here to do. Otherwise, you will live your life as a prostitute, you will do things only for a reason, to please other people, and you will never have lived. and you will not have a pleasant death." -- Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
item.description: "When I die I'm going to dance first in all the galaxies...I'm gonna play and dance and sing." -- Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "There was nothing I wanted to do more than be unconscious again, wrapped in black, gone away. I was raw. I felt swollen with potential tears, like a water balloon filled to burst. Begging for a pin prick." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I often don't say things out loud, even when I should. I contain and compartmentalize to a disturbing degree: In my belly-basement are hundreds of bottles of rage, despair, fear, but you'd never guess from looking at me." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "To spend a life in dreams, that sounded too lovely." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "Safer to be feared than loved." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I don't know that we are actually human at this point, those of us who are like most of us, who grew up with the words to say; when a loved one dies, we know the words to say. If we want to play the stud or the smart-ass or the fool, we know the words to say. We are all working from the same dog-eared script. It's a very difficult era in which to be a person, just a real, actual person, instead of a collection of personality traits selected from an endless Automat of characters." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I still believed he'd love me again somehow, love me that intense, thick way he did, the way that made everything good." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "I am a thornbush, bristling from the overattention of my parents, and he is a man of a million little fatherly stab wounds, and my thorns fit perfectly into them." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "It had gotten to the point where it seemed like nothing matters, because I’m not a real person and neither is anyone else." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "This is the unforgiving light of the morning, time to drop the illusion." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "A child weaned on poison considers harm a comfort." -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gillian Flynn
item.description: "How do you keep safe when your whole day is as wide and empty as the sky?" -- Gillian Flynn

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description:
"Responsibility to yourself means refusing to let others do your thinking, talking, and naming for you...it means that you do not treat your body as a commodity with which to purchase superficial intimacy or economic security; for our bodies to be treated as objects, our minds are in mortal danger. It means insisting that those to whom you give your friendship and love are able to respect your mind. It means being able to say, with Charlotte Bronte's Jane Eyre: "I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all the extraneous delights should be withheld or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give.
Responsibility to yourself means that you don't fall for shallow and easy solutions--predigested books and ideas...marrying early as an escape from real decisions, getting pregnant as an evasion of already existing problems. It means that you refuse to sell your talents and aspirations short...and this, in turn, means resisting the forces in society which say that women should be nice, play safe, have low professional expectations, drown in love and forget about work, live through others, and stay in the places assigned to us. It means that we insist on a life of meaningful work, insist that work be as meaningful as love and friendship in our lives. It means, therefore, the courage to be "different"...The difference between a life lived actively, and a life of passive drifting and dispersal of energies, is an immense difference. Once we begin to feel committed to our lives, responsible to ourselves, we can never again be satisfied with the old, passive way." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Because children grow up, we think a child's purpose is to grow up. But a child's purpose is to be a child. Nature doesn't disdain what lives only for a day. It pours the whole of itself into the each moment. We don't value the lily less for not being made of flint and built to last. Life's bounty is in its flow, later is too late. Where is the song when it's been sung? The dance when it's been danced? It's only we humans who want to own the future, too. We persuade ourselves that the universe is modestly employed in unfolding our destination. We note the haphazard chaos of history by the day, by the hour, but there is something wrong with the picture. Where is the unity, the meaning, of nature's highest creation? Surely those millions of little streams of accident and wilfulness have their correction in the vast underground river which, without a doubt, is carrying us to the place where we're expected! But there is no such place, that's why it's called utopia. The death of a child has no more meaning than the death of armies, of nations. Was the child happy while he lived? That is a proper question, the only question. If we can't arrange our own happiness, it's a conceit beyond vulgarity to arrange the happiness of those who come after us." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Amy Hempel
item.description: "He wondered how we know that what happens to us isn't good." -- Amy Hempel

item.title: Michelle add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "A doctor once told me I feel too much. I said, so does god. that’s why you can see the grand canyon from the moon." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "Forests may be gorgeous but there is nothing more alive than a tree that learns how to grow in a cemetery." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "I know you think this world is too dark to even dream in color, but I’ve seen flowers bloom at midnight. I’ve seen kites fly in gray skies and they were real close to looking like the sunrise, and sometime it takes the most wounded wings the most broken things to notice how strong the breeze is, how precious the flight." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "Do you think anger is a sincere emotion or the timid motion of a fragile heart trying to beat away its pain?" -- Andrea Gibson
